title: Option: rum.desktops.hyprland.enable
content: Whether to enable Hyprland.

title: Option: rum.desktops.hyprland.extraConfig
content: Extra configuration that will be appended verbatim at the end of your .

title: Option: rum.desktops.hyprland.importantPrefixes
content: List of prefix of attributes to source at the top of the config.

title: Option: rum.desktops.hyprland.plugins
content: List of Hyprland plugins to use. Can either be packages or absolute plugin paths.

title: Option: rum.desktops.hyprland.settings
content: Hyprland configuration written in Nix. Entries with the same key should be written as lists. Variables' and colors' names should be quoted. See Hyprland's documentation for more examples.

title: Option: rum.desktops.niri.binds
content: A list of key bindings that will be added to the configuration file. See niri's wiki for a complete list.

title: Option: rum.desktops.niri.binds.<name>.action
content: The non-spawn action to run on button-press. For spawning processes, please see {option} . See niri's wiki for a complete list.

title: Option: rum.desktops.niri.binds.<name>.parameters
content: The parameters to append to the bind. See niri's wiki for a complete list.

title: Option: rum.desktops.niri.binds.<name>.spawn
content: The spawn action to run on button-press. For other actions, please see {option} . See niri's wiki for more information.

title: Option: rum.desktops.niri.config
content: Lines of KDL code that are added to {file} . See a full list of options in niri's wiki . To add to environment, please see {option} . Here's an example of adding a file to your niri configuration: Optionally, you can split your niri configuration into multiple KDL files like so: Finally, if you need to interpolate some Nix variables into your configuration:

title: Option: rum.desktops.niri.enable
content: Whether to enable niri: A scrollable-tiling Wayland compositor.

title: Option: rum.desktops.niri.extraVariables
content: Extra environmental variables to be added to Niri's node. This can be used to override variables set in {option} . You can therefore set a variable to to force unset it in Niri. Learn more from niri's wiki .

title: Option: rum.desktops.niri.package
content: The niri package to use. Only used to validate the generated config file. Set to to disable the check phase.

title: Option: rum.desktops.niri.spawn-at-startup
content: A list of programs to be loaded with niri on startup. see niri's wiki for more details on the API.

title: Option: rum.environment.hideWarning
content: Whether to enable a warning for env vars not being implemented.

title: Option: rum.misc.gtk.bookmarks
content: Bookmarks used by GTK file managers (ex. Nautilus). Each entry should have one of the following formats:

title: Option: rum.misc.gtk.css.gtk3
content: CSS to be written to {file} . You can either use this as lines or you can reference a CSS file from your theme's package (or both).

title: Option: rum.misc.gtk.css.gtk4
content: CSS to be written to {file} . You can either use this as lines or you can reference a CSS file from your theme's package (or both).

title: Option: rum.misc.gtk.enable
content: Whether to enable GTK configuration.

title: Option: rum.misc.gtk.gtk2Location
content: The location relative to {env} to write the GTK-2.0 settings to. By default, apps search at {file} , but the environmental variable {env} can be set to a different location.

title: Option: rum.misc.gtk.packages
content: The list of packages to be installed for gtk themes. This list should consist of any packages that will be used by your GTK theme(s).

title: Option: rum.misc.gtk.settings
content: The settings that will be written to the various gtk files to configure the GTK theme. GTK documentation is perhaps nebulous, but the Arch Wiki entry and the official GTK documentation are decent places to start. Please note that each option name will have "gtk-" prepended to it, so there is no need to include that on every single option.

title: Option: rum.programs.alacritty.enable
content: Whether to enable Alacritty.

title: Option: rum.programs.alacritty.package
content: The alacritty package to use.

title: Option: rum.programs.alacritty.settings
content: The configuration converted into TOML and written to {file} . Please reference Alacritty's documentation for config options.

title: Option: rum.programs.beets.enable
content: Whether to enable beets.

title: Option: rum.programs.beets.package
content: The beets package to use. To get plugins to work, you will need to override the beets derivation with the plugins you want. Consult the beets derivation for a list of available plugins.

title: Option: rum.programs.beets.settings
content: Beets configuration that is written to {file} . Refer to the beets documentation for available options. If you would like to use plugins, please consult the description of rum.programs.beets.package and the official plugin documentation on the plugins configuration.

title: Option: rum.programs.bottom.enable
content: Whether to enable bottom.

title: Option: rum.programs.bottom.package
content: The bottom package to use.

title: Option: rum.programs.bottom.settings
content: The configuration converted into TOML and written to {file} . Please reference bottom's config file documentation for config options.

title: Option: rum.programs.chawan.enable
content: Whether to enable chawan.

title: Option: rum.programs.chawan.package
content: The chawan package to use.

title: Option: rum.programs.chawan.settings
content: Configuration written to {file} . Please reference chawan's documentation for config options.

title: Option: rum.programs.direnv.direnvrc
content: Bash code loaded before every . Good for personal extensions. Find community-maintained examples in direnv's wiki

title: Option: rum.programs.direnv.enable
content: Whether to enable direnv.

title: Option: rum.programs.direnv.integrations.fish.enable
content: Whether to enable direnv integration with fish.

title: Option: rum.programs.direnv.integrations.nix-direnv.enable
content: Whether to enable direnv integration with nix-direnv.

title: Option: rum.programs.direnv.integrations.nix-direnv.package
content: The nix-direnv package to use.

title: Option: rum.programs.direnv.integrations.nushell.enable
content: Whether to enable direnv integration with nushell.

title: Option: rum.programs.direnv.integrations.zsh.enable
content: Whether to enable direnv integration with zsh.

title: Option: rum.programs.direnv.package
content: The direnv package to use.

title: Option: rum.programs.direnv.settings
content: Configuration written to {file} . Please reference direnv's documentation for config options.

title: Option: rum.programs.fastfetch.enable
content: Whether to enable Fastfetch.

title: Option: rum.programs.fastfetch.package
content: The fastfetch package to use.

title: Option: rum.programs.fastfetch.settings
content: The configuration written to {file} . Please reference Json Schema for more information.

title: Option: rum.programs.fish.abbrs
content: A set of fish abbreviations, they will be set up with the fish builtin.

title: Option: rum.programs.fish.aliases
content: A set of fish aliases, they will be set up with the fish builtin.

title: Option: rum.programs.fish.config
content: The main configuration for fish, written verbatim to .

title: Option: rum.programs.fish.earlyConfigFiles
content: Extra configuration files, they will all be written verbatim to {file} . Those files are run before {file} as per the fish documentation .

title: Option: rum.programs.fish.enable
content: Whether to enable fish.

title: Option: rum.programs.fish.functions
content: A fish function which is being written to . If the input value is a string, its contents will be wrapped inside of a function declaration, like so: Otherwise you are expected to handle that yourself.

title: Option: rum.programs.fish.package
content: The fish package to use.

title: Option: rum.programs.fish.plugins
content: An attrset of plugins. In the case where a plugin is a 'vendored' plugin, all we are doing is adding that plugin to . As fish automatically discovers those files. A vendored plugin is denoted by the existence of one of the following files in its derivation: /share/fish/vendor_conf.d /share/fish/vendor_completions.d /share/fish/vendor_functions.d This will be the case with plugins present in . For the remaining cases, a file will be created at . It will attempt to handle or source a variety of expected files from the derivation. Those files are: : is added to : is added to , , : sourced in this order If a plugin seems to not work, verify that it contains one of the aformentioned files.

title: Option: rum.programs.flameshot.enable
content: Whether to enable flameshot.

title: Option: rum.programs.flameshot.package
content: The flameshot package to use.

title: Option: rum.programs.flameshot.settings
content: Configuration written to {file} . Please reference flameshot's example config for config options.

title: Option: rum.programs.foot.enable
content: Whether to enable foot.

title: Option: rum.programs.foot.package
content: The foot package to use.

title: Option: rum.programs.foot.settings
content: Settings are written as an INI file to {file} . Refer to {manpage} or the upstream template for all available options.

title: Option: rum.programs.fuzzel.enable
content: Whether to enable fuzzel.

title: Option: rum.programs.fuzzel.package
content: The fuzzel package to use.

title: Option: rum.programs.fuzzel.settings
content: Is written to {file} . Please reference {manpage} for configuration options.

title: Option: rum.programs.fzf.enable
content: Whether to enable fzf.

title: Option: rum.programs.fzf.integrations.fish.enable
content: Whether to enable fzf integration with fish.

title: Option: rum.programs.fzf.integrations.zsh.enable
content: Whether to enable fzf integration with zsh.

title: Option: rum.programs.fzf.package
content: The fzf package to use.

title: Option: rum.programs.gammastep.enable
content: Whether to enable gammastep.

title: Option: rum.programs.gammastep.package
content: The gammastep package to use.

title: Option: rum.programs.gammastep.settings
content: Settings are written as an INI file to {file} . Refer to gammastep's example configuration all available options.

title: Option: rum.programs.ghostty.enable
content: Whether to enable Ghostty.

title: Option: rum.programs.ghostty.package
content: The ghostty package to use. You can use an override to configure some settings baked into the package.

title: Option: rum.programs.ghostty.settings
content: The configuration converted to INI and written to {file} . Please consult Ghostty's option reference for configuration options.

title: Option: rum.programs.ghostty.themes
content: An attribute set of themes, with the key as the theme name. Please reference Ghostty's color theme documentation for configuration options.

title: Option: rum.programs.git.attributes
content: Global user-level version of .gitattributes written to {file} .

title: Option: rum.programs.git.enable
content: Whether to enable git.

title: Option: rum.programs.git.ignore
content: Global user-level version of .gitignore written to {file} .

title: Option: rum.programs.git.integrations.difftastic.enable
content: Whether to enable git integration with difftastic.

title: Option: rum.programs.git.integrations.difftastic.flags
content: Command-line flags passed to . Please run for configuration options.

title: Option: rum.programs.git.integrations.difftastic.package
content: The difftastic package to use.

title: Option: rum.programs.git.package
content: The git package to use.

title: Option: rum.programs.git.settings
content: Settings that will be written to your configuration file.

title: Option: rum.programs.helix.enable
content: Whether to enable Helix.

title: Option: rum.programs.helix.languages
content: The languages configurations converted into TOML and written to {file} . Please reference Helix's language documentation for config options.

title: Option: rum.programs.helix.package
content: The helix package to use.

title: Option: rum.programs.helix.settings
content: The editor configuration converted into TOML and written to {file} . Please reference Helix's documentation for config options.

title: Option: rum.programs.helix.themes
content: The custom themes converted into TOML and written to {file} . Please reference Helix's theming documentation for config options.

title: Option: rum.programs.hypridle.enable
content: Whether to enable hypridle.

title: Option: rum.programs.hypridle.package
content: The hypridle package to use.

title: Option: rum.programs.hypridle.settings
content: Is written to {file} . Configuration options can be found on the Hyprland Wiki .

title: Option: rum.programs.hyprlock.enable
content: Whether to enable hyprlock.

title: Option: rum.programs.hyprlock.package
content: The hyprlock package to use.

title: Option: rum.programs.hyprlock.settings
content: Is written to {file} . Configuration options can be found on the Hyprland Wiki .

title: Option: rum.programs.keepassxc.enable
content: Whether to enable KeePassXC.

title: Option: rum.programs.keepassxc.package
content: The keepassxc package to use.

title: Option: rum.programs.keepassxc.settings
content: Settings are written as an INI file to {file} . Please reference KeePassXC's User Guide . It also can be configured by toggling options through the GUI, but this does not seem documented.

title: Option: rum.programs.kitty.enable
content: Whether to enable kitty.

title: Option: rum.programs.kitty.integrations.fish.enable
content: Whether to enable kitty integration with fish.

title: Option: rum.programs.kitty.integrations.zsh.enable
content: Whether to enable kitty integration with zsh.

title: Option: rum.programs.kitty.package
content: The kitty package to use.

title: Option: rum.programs.kitty.settings
content: Configuration written to {file} . Please reference kitty's documentation for config options.

title: Option: rum.programs.kitty.theme.dark
content: Dark theme to be linked to {file} . This theme is set when your OS theme is set to dark. Please reference kitty-themes' repository for available themes.

title: Option: rum.programs.kitty.theme.light
content: Light theme to be linked to {file} . This theme is set when your OS theme is set to light. Please reference kitty-themes' repository for available themes.

title: Option: rum.programs.kitty.theme.no-preference
content: no-preference theme to be linked to {file} . This theme is set when your OS does not specify any theme preference. Please reference kitty-themes' repository for available themes.

title: Option: rum.programs.lsd.colors
content: Configuration written to {file} , defining the colors used by lsd. Please reference lsd's color theme example to configure it accordingly.

title: Option: rum.programs.lsd.enable
content: Whether to enable LSD (LSDeluxe).

title: Option: rum.programs.lsd.icons
content: Configuration written to {file} , defining the icons used by lsd. Please reference lsd's icon theme example to configure it accordingly.

title: Option: rum.programs.lsd.package
content: The lsd package to use.

title: Option: rum.programs.lsd.settings
content: Configuration written to {file} , defining lsd settings. Please reference lsd's example configuration to configure it accordingly.

title: Option: rum.programs.mpv.bindings
content: Inputs converted and written to {file} . See the manpage {manpage} for more information.

title: Option: rum.programs.mpv.config
content: Configuration converted and written to {file} . See the manpage {manpage} for the full list of options.

title: Option: rum.programs.mpv.enable
content: Whether to enable mpv.

title: Option: rum.programs.mpv.package
content: The mpv package to use.

title: Option: rum.programs.mpv.profiles
content: Profiles converted and written to {file} . See the manpage {manpage} for more information.

title: Option: rum.programs.mpv.scriptOpts
content: Script options converted and written to {file} . See the manpage {manpage} for the full list of options of builtin scripts.

title: Option: rum.programs.mpv.scripts
content: List of scripts to use with mpv.

title: Option: rum.programs.ncmpcpp.bindings
content: Custom bindings configuration written to {file} . Please reference {manpage} to configure it accordingly, or consult ncmpcpp's example bindings file . The lists are separated between keys, for actions ran on keypresses, and commands, for actions ran on commands. The option's example demonstrates this greatly.

title: Option: rum.programs.ncmpcpp.bindings.<name>.*.actions
content: The actions to be ran on either the key's or command's activation.

title: Option: rum.programs.ncmpcpp.bindings.<name>.*.binding
content: The key or command for which the set of actions is binded to.

title: Option: rum.programs.ncmpcpp.bindings.<name>.*.deferred
content: Whether the binding or command should be deferred (true) or immediate (false).

title: Option: rum.programs.ncmpcpp.enable
content: Whether to enable ncmpcpp, a mpd-based music player..

title: Option: rum.programs.ncmpcpp.package
content: The ncmpcpp package to use. You can override the package to customize certain settings that are baked into the package.

title: Option: rum.programs.ncmpcpp.settings
content: Configuration written to {file} . Please reference {manpage} to configure it accordingly, or consult ncmpcpp's example configuration .

title: Option: rum.programs.neovide.enable
content: Whether to enable neovide.

title: Option: rum.programs.neovide.package
content: The neovide package to use.

title: Option: rum.programs.neovide.settings
content: Configuration written to {file} . Please reference neovide's documentation for config options.

title: Option: rum.programs.nix-your-shell.enable
content: Whether to enable nix-your-shell.

title: Option: rum.programs.nix-your-shell.integrations.fish.enable
content: Whether to enable nix-your-shell integration with fish.

title: Option: rum.programs.nix-your-shell.integrations.nushell.enable
content: Whether to enable nix-your-shell integration with nushell.

title: Option: rum.programs.nix-your-shell.integrations.zsh.enable
content: Whether to enable nix-your-shell integration with zsh.

title: Option: rum.programs.nix-your-shell.package
content: The nix-your-shell package to use.

title: Option: rum.programs.nushell.aliases
content: A set of aliases for nushell, converted into nu and written to {file} . Please note that we cannot handle complex aliases that use at this time. Please see The Nushell Book for a simple tutorial.

title: Option: rum.programs.nushell.enable
content: Whether to enable nushell.

title: Option: rum.programs.nushell.envFile
content: Extra configuration to be written to {file} . Please keep in mind that the upstream documentation generally advises against writing to this file, and instead suggests using {file} . See The Nushell Book for more info.

title: Option: rum.programs.nushell.extraConfig
content: Extra configuration to be written to {file} . Please see The Nushell Book for more info.

title: Option: rum.programs.nushell.loginFile
content: Nushell may be used as a login shell, so this option writes to {file} to allow you to configure nushell as your login shell. Please recognize that this is mainly for advanced users and is not for the faint of heart. Direct your questions and concerns to The Nushell Book for more information.

title: Option: rum.programs.nushell.package
content: The nushell package to use.

title: Option: rum.programs.nushell.plugins
content: A list of plugin packages to be installed and added to the nushell plugin registry.

title: Option: rum.programs.nushell.settings
content: A set of options for nushell, flattened, prepended with to avoid overwriting (tables of config are overwritten if they occupy the same namespace). It is then written to {file} . Please see The Nushell Book for configuration options.

title: Option: rum.programs.obs-studio.enable
content: Whether to enable OBS Studio.

title: Option: rum.programs.obs-studio.package
content: The obs-studio package to use. You can override the package to install plugins.

title: Option: rum.programs.spotify-player.enable
content: Whether to enable spotify_player.

title: Option: rum.programs.spotify-player.keymap
content: Sets of keymaps and actions converted into TOML and written to {file} . See example for how to format declarations. Please reference spotify_player's keymaps documentation for more information.

title: Option: rum.programs.spotify-player.package
content: The spotify-player package to use. You can use an override to configure certain settings baked into the package.

title: Option: rum.programs.spotify-player.settings
content: The configuration converted into TOML and written to {file} . Please reference spotify_player's configuration documentation for configuration options.

title: Option: rum.programs.spotify-player.themes
content: The theme converted into TOML and written to {file} . Please reference spotify_player's theme documentation for configuration options.

title: Option: rum.programs.starship.enable
content: Whether to enable starship module..

title: Option: rum.programs.starship.integrations.fish.enable
content: Whether to enable starship integration with fish.

title: Option: rum.programs.starship.integrations.nushell.enable
content: Whether to enable starship integration with nushell.

title: Option: rum.programs.starship.integrations.zsh.enable
content: Whether to enable starship integration with zsh.

title: Option: rum.programs.starship.package
content: The starship package to use.

title: Option: rum.programs.starship.settings
content: The configuration converted to TOML and written to {file} . Please reference Starship's documentation for configuration options.

title: Option: rum.programs.starship.transience.enable
content: Whether to enable enable transience.

title: Option: rum.programs.tealdeer.enable
content: Whether to enable tealdeer.

title: Option: rum.programs.tealdeer.package
content: The tealdeer package to use.

title: Option: rum.programs.tealdeer.settings
content: Configuration written to {file} . Please reference tealdeer's documentation for config options.

title: Option: rum.programs.tofi.enable
content: Whether to enable tofi.

title: Option: rum.programs.tofi.package
content: The tofi package to use.

title: Option: rum.programs.tofi.settings
content: The configuration converted into "key = value" and written to {file} . Please reference {manpage} , or see an example at tofi's default configuration .

title: Option: rum.programs.vscode.enable
content: Whether to enable Visual Studio Code.

title: Option: rum.programs.vscode.package
content: The vscode package to use.

title: Option: rum.programs.vscode.settings
content: The configuration converted into JSON and written to {file} . Please reference Visual Studio Code's official documentation for more information.

title: Option: rum.programs.yazi.enable
content: Whether to enable yazi file manager.

title: Option: rum.programs.yazi.keymap
content: The keymap configurations converted to TOML and written to {file} . Please reference yazi's keymap configuration documentation for configuration options.

title: Option: rum.programs.yazi.package
content: The yazi package to use.

title: Option: rum.programs.yazi.settings
content: The configurations converted to TOML and written to {file} . Please reference yazi's configuration documentation for configuration options.

title: Option: rum.programs.yazi.theme
content: The keymap configurations converted to TOML and written to {file} . Please reference yazi's theming configuration documentation for configuration options.

title: Option: rum.programs.zed.enable
content: Whether to enable zed.

title: Option: rum.programs.zed.keymap
content: Configuration written to {file} . Please reference zed's documentation for config options.

title: Option: rum.programs.zed.package
content: The zed-editor package to use.

title: Option: rum.programs.zed.settings
content: Configuration written to {file} . Please reference zed's documentation for config options.

title: Option: rum.programs.zed.snippets
content: Custom scoped snippets written to {file} Please reference zed's documentation for more details.

title: Option: rum.programs.zed.tasks
content: Configuration written to {file} . Please reference zed's documentation for config options.

title: Option: rum.programs.zed.themes
content: Custom themes written to {file} Please reference zed's documentation for more details.

title: Option: rum.programs.zoxide.enable
content: Whether to enable zoxide.

title: Option: rum.programs.zoxide.flags
content: Command-line flags passed to . Please reference zoxide's documentation for configuration options.

title: Option: rum.programs.zoxide.integrations.fish.enable
content: Whether to enable zoxide integration with fish.

title: Option: rum.programs.zoxide.integrations.nushell.enable
content: Whether to enable zoxide integration with nushell.

title: Option: rum.programs.zoxide.integrations.zsh.enable
content: Whether to enable zoxide integration with zsh.

title: Option: rum.programs.zoxide.package
content: The zoxide package to use.

title: Option: rum.programs.zsh.enable
content: Whether to enable zsh.

title: Option: rum.programs.zsh.initConfig
content: Commands that will be added verbatim to {file} . A good starting point for learning how to configure zsh is the Arch Wiki entry .

title: Option: rum.programs.zsh.loginConfig
content: Commands that will be added verbatim to {file} . A good starting point for learning how to configure zsh is the Arch Wiki entry .

title: Option: rum.programs.zsh.logoutConfig
content: Commands that will be added verbatim to {file} . A good starting point for learning how to configure zsh is the Arch Wiki entry .

title: Option: rum.programs.zsh.package
content: The zsh package to use.

title: Option: rum.programs.zsh.plugins
content: An attrset of plugins to load into zsh. Configuration of the former can be done and is advised to be done at this level, for the sake of organization.

title: Option: rum.programs.zsh.plugins.<name>.completions
content: A list of completions that will be loaded into .

title: Option: rum.programs.zsh.plugins.<name>.config
content: Commands that will be added verbatim to {file} right after the plugin import.. A good starting point for learning how to configure zsh is the Arch Wiki entry .

title: Option: rum.programs.zsh.plugins.<name>.source
content: Path to the plugin file to load.
